definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: And that help is not just in the form of paper cranes.
sentences.chinese: 以及可以帮助不只是在纸鹤的形式。

sentences.english: Process Overview picked up that day the boy saw the girl again.
sentences.chinese: 捡起千纸鹤的那一天，男孩再次看到了女孩。

sentences.english: He looked at Process Overviewbegan to recall a past.
sentences.chinese: 他看着千纸鹤，开始回忆一段往事。

sentences.english: Michael watches the crane tumble through the air and flutter into a room below.
sentences.chinese: 看着纸鹤跌跌撞撞地飘到了下面的房间里。

sentences.english: The variety of aesthetic consciousness promotes the new advancement in process of folding paper cranes.
sentences.chinese: 审美口味的多样性促使千纸鹤的折法有了新的发展。

sentences.english: The most well known origami model is probably the Japanese paper crane.
sentences.chinese: 这之中最出名的就是日本的千纸鹤。

sentences.english: Make a paper bird and write the new year wishes on it.
sentences.chinese: 每人做一只千纸鹤，写上新年打算。

sentences.english: So they have decorated their school with paper origami cranes. Their wish is for a speedy recovery for the Japanese people.
sentences.chinese: 他们用纸鹤装饰他们的学校，祈望日本人民早日恢复。

sentences.english: Mothers hung colorful paper cranes for their lost children.
sentences.chinese: 失去孩子的母亲悬挂起彩色的千纸鹤。

sentences.english: For a very long time, folded-paper cranes have been symbols of peace and love.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，千纸鹤一直被视为和平与爱的象征。

sentences.english: Michael places the old crane on the table.
sentences.chinese: Michael把那个旧的纸鹤放在桌面上。

definition: a piece, scrap or fragment of paper
(Taoism) talisman in the form of a painting of symbols thought to have magical powers
records/book/Taoist written charm/book of prophecy (e.g. of dynastic fortunes)
